definition: Appetite and lust are only natural (Mencius 6A:4)./By nature we desire food and sex.
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
a feast for the eyes (idiom)/(of women) gorgeous/graceful/(of scenery) beautiful
Food is the God of the people. (idiom); People view food as the primary need./Food first, ethical niceties second

pinyin: ai4 mei3 zhi1 xin1 , ren2 jie1 you3 zhi1

definition: lit. a nobleman stays clear of the kitchen (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. a nobleman who has seen a living animal cannot bear to see it die, hence he keeps away from the kitchen
even heroes have a weakness for the charms of a beautiful woman (idiom)
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 nan2 guo4 mei3 ren2 guan1

definition: lit. to eat but finely ground grain and finely chopped meat (idiom, from Analects)/fig. to be fastidious about one's food
pinyin: shi2 bu4 yan4 jing1 , kuai4 bu4 yan4 xi4

definition: lit. there is a knife above the character for lust/fig. lascivious activities can lead to bitter consequences
pinyin: se4 zi4 tou2 shang4 yi1 ba3 dao1
